page.title: 05SPETISBURY EARLY 2Oth.CENT.
page.content: Mr.John J.O'Reilly-age 7O moved to Spetisbury when he was one year old.He went to the Priory School at 4 years old then on to Hall and Sloper now Spetisbury First School at 5.He left school at 14 and then went to work at Gannetts Mead (next to rectory) as a gardener's boy.While at school he was a paper boy at the local shop earning a shilling a week.There were 5 pubs in Spetisbury -The Dog,The Castle Inn,The Bugle,The Railway and The Drax.Today the last two remain.Every house had their own well.There were only three cars in the village.The whole village had one day off a year and went either by train or on a charabanc to Bournemouth.The railway station had 3 porters and a station master and milk and watercress were despatched daily by train.
